intro: Tephrosia sambesiaca, commonly known as the Brazilian tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, and it has compound leaves with trifoliate or pinnate structures. Tephrosia sambesiaca is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
